fields.description:
When sharing a filter with Public, anonymous users will have the ability to read the JQL syntax of the filter. Part of the JQL may include usernames, project names and other sensitive data.

As an administrator, I'd like the JQL syntax to not be visible to anonymous users.
fields.summary: JQL syntax should be hidden when sharing the filter to Public

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, there is no other way to disable the activity stream in the user profile other than disabling the plugin itself. As an Administrator, admin would like the ability to disable user's activity stream to protect their data and flow of work.

As a workaround, users can try to use [Personal Activity Stream Hide|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1219047/personal-activity-stream-hide?hosting=server&tab=overview].
fields.summary: Ability to disable Activity Stream in User Profile only

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Adding Comment In JIRA Service Desk Will Not Show Loading or Buffer Icon in JIRA 7.12.3 and JIRA 7.13. The buffer or loading icon will show in older JIRA version (tested on JIRA 7.6.9). This doesn't cause any huge impact but it is confusing JIRA Service Desk agent and they think the comment was failed to add and click add comment again.

h3. Environment
JIRA 7.12.3, 7.13

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a comment in JIRA 7.6.9 and you should see a loading icon on your right-hand side.
# Add a comment in JIRA 7.13, the icon is not showing there anymore which causing confusion for JIRA's user

h3. Expected Results
Loading icon should show when JIRA loading after we add a comment
 !loading.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
No loading icon show

h3. Workaround
-
fields.summary: Adding Comment In JIRA Service Desk Will Not Show Loading or Buffer Icon

fields.description:
Currently, single issue export in "Printable" format cannot be modified from Jira interface.

It would be useful to have Jira editor where we could create our own template for exporting in "Printable" format.
fields.summary: Possibility to customize "Printable" export format

fields.description:
AsciiDoc has become a very popular format for writing documentation, README files, website contents and even books in the open source community. It's well supported by tool chains for producing documentation and platforms such as GitHub which e.g. render AsciiDoc-formatted files.

It'd therefore be very useful if AsciiDoc could also be used when authoring Jira issues, e.g. in the description field and comments. That'd mean less friction when switching between different tools, as e.g. the syntax for hyperlinks differs between Jira and AsciiDoc.
fields.summary: Support AsciiDoc syntax in Jira issue descriptions and comments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a user starts watching an issue, removes himself and immediately starts watching it again the watchers list is not updated, unless he/she repeats the operation.
 
h3. Environment
Jira Server: 7.12.3
Jira Service Desk: 3.15.3
PostgreSQL: 9.6
Browsers:  latest Chrome & Firefox

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click on *Start watching this issue*
# Click on *View watchers* (count icon)
# Locate your user and remove it
# Close the dialog box
# At this point the count will be subtracted by one and will remain highlighted
# The link will change from *Stop watching this issue* to *Start watching this issue*
# Upon clicking *Start watching this issue* the counter will no longer be highlighted and the user won't be added to the watchers list
# Clicking it a second time will add the user and adjust the count 

h3. Expected Results
Users to be normally added to the watchers list.

h3. Actual Results
Under these specific circumstances, users will feel as if they have to always click twice for this option to work. 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: "Start watching this issue" does not always add a user on the watchers list

fields.description:
As of Jira 7.13, it is understood that most, if not all functions related to a project are ruled by the Project's Permission scheme. On top of this, it is assumed by most users that Application access is on a security layer on top of the project's Permission scheme and this is generally true but there is an exception: 
when a user is involved in a ticket as the reporter, watcher or assignee, and an event is triggered, the Notification scheme checks who should receive the notification for it, and it is required that each user has the _Browse project_ permission. 

When talking about the Browse project permission, one of the sections of options is *Application Access* and from that list, we have "Any logged in user". In theory adding this to the Browse Project permission will allow any existent user in the database to see the issues of the project BUT it does not consider if the users have application access and this leads to users without any application access (like Service Desk customers) to technically have browse project permissions even when they cannot log in directly to Jira. This itself is not a problem, as cannot log in to Jira after all, but this in turn enables an scenario with the Jira Notifications, as the Notification scheme does not validate application access either, and when an event is triggered, the validation seems to be like this:
# Event fired (let's say Issue creation)
# Checks the users/groups/roles involved included in the event (Assignee, Reporter, watchers, etc) and validates they have_Browse projects_ permission and sends the notification email to all that do (regardless of application access).

When a user creates and issue and sets another user as the reporter, if that new reporter does not have application access, and the previous scenario is met (Browse project permission including "Any logged in user" and Notification scheme including the reporter for the "Create  Issue" or any other event), the user without application access will receive Jira notifications, showing internal comments and changes that would normally not be visible to customers.

All this make sense in a logical way but since the assumption for "Any logged in user" is that it does not supersedes the application access, the behavior seems counter intuitive. 

The suggestion is to add a note in the [Managing project permissions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/managing-project-permissions-938847145.html] OR in the [Configuring email notifications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/configuring-email-notifications-938847633.html] documentation pages, indicating that Users without application access will still receive notifications in this scenario.
fields.summary: Clarify documentation about "Any logged in user" for Browse Project Permissions

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Some customers have Jira Service Desk and Jira Software installed on the same server. In *Board Configuration* > *Card Layout*, it is therefore possible to add the 'Time to Resolution' field and other SLA fields, however, they do not actually render when viewing _Active Sprints_ on a Scrum or  Kanban board. The field _does_ display as expected in the backlog view of a Scrum board.  

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow all SLA fields to be displayed on Agile cards. 

h3. Why this is important

Some customers have both Jira Software and Jira Service Desk and have agents who prefer to use a kanban or scrum board to view and manage work. To help with prioritisation, they would like SLA fields to show in the card layout view on agile boards. 
 
h3. Workaround 

None
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to view Jira Service Desk SLA fields on Agile cards so that I can prioritize my work easier using Agile boards

fields.description:
h3. Description
If a customer wants to set up their permission scheme so only Administrators, Reporters and Watchers can Browse Issues on that project, the Watcher can only be added when creating the issue. If the issue is already created, the same user cannot be added as Watcher as he primarily doesn't have access to browse that issue.

h3. Use Case
Customer wants to configure a project permission scheme where only Administrators, Reporters and Watchers can Browse Issues on that project.

At first, he changed the permission scheme like the above. When creating a new issue on that project and adding a Watcher that primarily didn't have access to the issue (because he wasn't an Administrator, nor the Reporter), the issue is created with success and the user is added as a Watcher normally.

But, if the issue is created without him added as a Watcher, and then the Administrator tries to add him, Jira returns with the message that he doesn't have access to view the issue, so it won't add him as Watcher.

h3. Investigation Done
We successfully reproduced such issue internally on the latest Jira version available. We tried to work with Issue Security Schemes, where the standard Permission Scheme would have "Browse Issues" to anyone logged on, but setting a Default Security Scheme where the previous permissions were configured, but the same behaviour was noticed. Even if we had no security scheme on the issue, added the Watcher (as he HAD permission), but tried to edit the issue to set the Issue Security Scheme we had, it didn't work because the Watcher wouldn't have permission with that Security Scheme.

We also tested creating a "Watcher" role, adding users to it and configuring the Issue Security Level to allow the role to browse issue, but the same thing happens.

That being said, we speculate that when the issue is being created and a Watcher is added, either there is no validation on the Watcher field permission to view the issue, or the validation occurs after considering the user a Watcher of that issue. Differently from when an already created issue denies adding the user as he doesn't have access to it.

h3. Solution Request
When you have an already created issue which Issue Security Scheme or Permission Scheme allows the Watcher field OR role to browse the issue in that project, and you try to add someone as a Watcher to that issue, Jira should understand that I, who already have access to the issue, am adding that person as a Watcher so it can view the issue and have access to it, just like it works when creating the issue.
fields.summary: Ability to add watchers who primarily didn't have access to browse the issue

fields.description:
From the JIRA UI, I can easily add labels such as below to a ticket
 * flow:foo_123
 * script:bar_456.hql

h2. problem

The use case is to assign meaningful labels via ejira. But if I try any of the options in ejira, the labels are not accepted:
{code:java}
jira-label: flow:HDP_ADS_MEMBER_FACET_CHANGES, OnCall, script=shell_gw.sh 

jira-label: 'flow:HDP_ADS_MEMBER_FACET_CHANGES',OnCall, "script:shell_gw.sh", [autosys]

jira-label: [flow:HDP_ADS_MEMBER_FACET_CHANGES], script|shell_gw.sh, OnCall
{code}
In the source file LabelParser I see the line
{noformat}
INVALID_PATTERN = Pattern.compile("[ ]");
{noformat}
Which explains why [ and ] are not allowed either. There is also a limit of 255 chars on a label

[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/Can-I-put-spaces-in-Jira-Label-fields/qaq-p/125926]
h2. suggestion

Relax the validation regexp to allow at least the following signs in labels
 * colon
 * equal
 * sharp
 * pipe

Thank you!
fields.summary: relax ejira regexp validation rule for label

fields.description:
h3. Summary

We would like a feature for notifications to be sent to a specific group during a field event. For example, if a priority of a task is changed, we would like only for the group 'Admin' to be able to receive those notification.

Instead of grouping it all in the 'Issue Updated' event, we would like a feature for us to select a field, field event and group that we would like the notifications to be sent to.

As for now, the workaround is to achieve this is you will need to write a custom event listener as described in this [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/adding-a-custom-event-938847495.html] or alternatively, you can try out a third-party add on : [Enterprise Email Handler for Jira (JEMH)|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/4832/enterprise-email-handler-for-jira-jemh?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] and [ScriptRunner for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/6820/scriptrunner-for-jira?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] that might be helpful in this situation.
fields.summary: Ability for notifications to be sent to a specific group during field event instead of grouping all fields in an Issue Updated event

fields.description:
Currently, when an email is received and processed by a Jira mail handler, if the email address has a semicolon at the end (in the "From" section), it will not process the email. This seems to be predominantly provoked by emails being sent from the Outlook desktop application and it is almost impossible to control the configuration of the customers mail clients.

 

The suggestion is to add the functions to allow Jira mail handlers to process emails that end semicolon just like they do with any other email.
fields.summary: Improve Jira Email handlers and addresses with semicolon at the end

fields.description:
As per the discussion items below, we would like to be able to change the parent of a sub-task via the REST API which currently cannot be done.  It seems that more than one customer would like this feature.

 
 # [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/Can-I-change-the-parent-field-of-sub-task-in-Jira-via-REST-API/qaq-p/750954]
 # [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Answers-Developer-Questions/Can-I-change-sub-task-parent-using-REST/qaq-p/466646]
fields.summary: REST API:  Allow changing the parent of a sub-task via the REST API

fields.description: In the history pane of Jira 7.12.1, it shows times rounded to nice human-readable values; I'm out of luck if I want to see a precise timestamp.
fields.summary: Please allow viewing a precise timestamp in JIRA history view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As an admin, I would like to send out Approval notification reminders through Jira Service Desk automation.

From Jira Service Desk 3.12 onward, approval notifications include buttons with links to the approve/deny an approval. 

When adding an automation rule with two when conditions, for example, SLA time remaining AND Approval required the buttons can not be used in the email template.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the variables to be added to the email template in JDS automation for templates other than the Approval required template.
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like to add approval buttons to automation rule emails

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition 

Currently, there is built-in limit of 1000 issues that can be exported. However, (per [Exporting a filter result containing more than 1000 issues|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/exporting-a-filter-result-containing-more-than-1000-issues-191500982.html]), you can either,
# Raise the limit for all users
# Set the limit to {{unlimited}} for a specific group.

The gap here is that there is no method of setting an explicit limit for a specific group, other than {{unlimited}}.

h3. Suggested Solution 

Add an option to set an explicit limit (for example, 2000) for a specific group while leaving the normal 1000 limit for all other users.

h3. Why this is important 

Administrators may not want to take on the potential instability that can occur when a group is given unlimited export abilities. However, they may want to use a sensible limit for a specific group that is higher than 1,000.
fields.summary: Set an explicit filter export limit for specific groups

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Per the Documentation [Configuring the issue detail view|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/configuring-the-issue-detail-view-938845334.html] Custom Fields are available in the issue details View Screen when configured per [Adding a custom field | https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/adding-a-custom-field-938847222.html], which also indicates that Custom fields provided by add-ons are configurable without issue on the view, however Field types from [Jira Misc Custom Fields | https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/27136/jira-misc-custom-fields?hosting=server&tab=overview] cannot be added to this view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install [JMCF | https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/27136/jira-misc-custom-fields?hosting=server&tab=overview]
# Create a custom field type i.e. Calculated Number Field
# Attempt to add the field to the issue details view per  [Configuring the issue detail view|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/configuring-the-issue-detail-view-938845334.html]
 
h3. Expected Results
The custom field is available

h3. Actual Results
The field is not available

h3. Notes
Other field types from add-on apps associate without issue.  This is either a disconnect in the documentation on the limitations of field type availability for varying custom field types provided by add-ons, or a broken field type association.

h3. Workaround
No workaround at this time
fields.summary: JMCF Custom Fields cannot be added to Issue Detail View

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The description of "Import Issues from CSV" is incorrect. Following fields in the document can't import.

[Creating issues using the CSV importer|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/creating-issues-using-the-csv-importer-939938927.html]
{quote}*Importing work log entries*
 Your CSV file can contain work log entries. For example:
{code:java}
Summary,Worklog
Only time spent (one hour),3600
With a date and an author,2012-02-10 12:30:10;wseliga;120
With an additional comment,Testing took me 3 days;2012-02-10 12:30:10;wseliga;259200
To track time spent, you need to use seconds.{code}

*Importing cascading choice custom fields*
You can import values to a cascading choice custom field using the following syntax:
{code}Summary, My Cascading Custom Field
Example Summary, Parent Value -> Child Value{code}
The '->' separator allows you to import the hierarchy.

*Tips for importing CSV data into issue fields*
||Issue Field||Import Notes||
|Comment Body|You can import issues with multiple comments by entering each comment in a separate column.|
|Due Date|Please use the date format specified on the second step of the CSV import wizard.|
|Original Estimate|The value of this field needs to be specified as number of seconds.|
|Remaining Estimate|The value of this field needs to be specified as number of seconds.|
|Time Spent|The value of this field needs to be specified as number of seconds.|
{quote}
Document mentioned about above fields but only following fields are available on Map Fields screen.
 * Sprint
 * Summary
 * Component/s
 * Affects Version/s
 * Fix Version/s
 * Issue Type
 * Labels
 * Priority
 * Description
 * Reporter
 * Environment
 * Assignee
 * Issue Id
 * Parent Id
 * Link "Blocks"
 * Link "Cloners"
 * Link "Duplicate"
 * Link "Relates"

h3. Suggestion
 * Make documentation clear that which field can import.
 * Clarify the difference between [Importing data from CSV|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/importing-data-from-csv-938847533.html] document.
fields.summary: Documentation fix for Import Issues from CSV

fields.description:
As per [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/custom-fields-with-global-contexts-956713282.html] the custom field optimizer will show custom fields that have a global context, but are used in less than 10 of all projects.

In very large instances (the size that this tool is aimed to help) it's conceivable that 10 might be too low a cutoff point.

It would be good for system administrators to be able to adjust the cutoff point (either as a value or a percentage, depending on what makes more sense).
fields.summary: As an administrator of a large instance, I'd like to control the threshold for the Custom Field Optimizer

fields.description:
Add "Watcher" or "Watched by me" to Criteria List in Issue Search Basic view

In our organization, users commonly would like to see a list of the issues they are watching.

"Watched by Me" is a filter which is made visible when using JIRA from a mobile device, but not in the desktop version.

In order to execute this in the desktop version, users must use JQL: "issue in watchedIssues()".

It would be more convenient to have this filter available from Issue Search Basic view.
fields.summary: Add "Watcher" or "Watched by me" to Criteria List in Issue Search Basic view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

There have historically been plenty of issues caused by a trailing empty space in usernames/groups. Jira appears to handle this in internal directories in recent versions, but there's a misalignment when it comes to external user management.

Here's a *few* bugs and behaviors that ultimately are traced back to trailing spaces. Here's some examples:

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-67262 - Updating roles through REST API did not work using username
 https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38290 - Can't add group with trailing spaces to a project role.
 https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-66599 - LDAP group can't be added during login due to duplicate key row
 https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-66959 - Trailing non-breaking space in user's USER_KEY causes error when adding user to a project role

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-login-fails-with-user-exists-but-has-no-unique-key-mapping-373261121.html]

Jira needs to handle these scenarios and be consistent, whether it originates in a local directory or through an external directory.

 
h3. Expected Results
Jira seamlessly handles trailing spaces in user and groups and does not throw exceptions when performing basic user management operations. Details outlined in the respective bugs above. 

h3. Actual Results
There have been plenty of historical bugs caused by Jira's inability to handle trailing space.
fields.summary: Align on how Jira handles trailing spaces in username/groups from internal and external directories

fields.description:
h3. Summary

A Proxy Error screen will be displayed when attempting to generate an XML backup while running Jira behind a proxy.
h3. Environment
 * Any version of Jira
 * Running behind reverse proxy with conservative timeout

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to *Administration > System > Backup System*
 # Start a backup of the instance
 # Wait a few minutes (until the proxy timeout is reached)

h3. Expected Results

Backup is completed with no error message.
h3. Actual Results

User receives 504 Gateway Timeout error
h3. Notes

This error happens because the backup procedure does not have a progress bar to indicate the state of the operation. When the backup is started, the browser keeps waiting for the backup to complete.

If the instance is fairly large, the backup will take longer than the proxy timeout configured and result in a 504 gateway timeout error. This is because there is no response from the application while the backup is being created.

Notice that the backup operation is not impacted. If you wait for its completion, the backup will be available in the *export* directory of the local home. However, we do not have any indication of the process state besides checking if the backup file stopped growing and is zipped in the directory above.

A possible solution would be having a progress bar to this process, as we have for the XML import procedure.
h3. Workaround

(!) Increasing the proxy timeout is not feasible as the backup can take hours to complete
 # The first workaround is to wait for the backup to complete by checking the backup file in the *export* directory. Once the file stops growing and a .zip file is created, the backup should be completed
 # The second workaround is to add a non-proxy connector to server.xml, access the site using the connector and execute the backup
fields.summary: Implement progress bar for XML backups to prevent proxy timeouts

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, our official [Sizing Guide|https://confluence.atlassian.com/enterprise/jira-sizing-guide-461504623.html] does only include heap size suggestion based on general database statistic. 

Some add-ons like Insight plugin requires additional heap memory and the vendor have their own documentation to provide a suggestion for recommended heap size:

* https://documentation.riada.io/insight/latest/system-requirements-29295574.html


h3. Suggested Solution

* Add a message in our [Sizing Guide|https://confluence.atlassian.com/enterprise/jira-sizing-guide-461504623.html] suggesting users to either contact the plugin vendor or have a look at the vendor documentation for recommended system requirement.

* We can also list the suggested system requirement for some popular plugin in the sizing guide page.

Eg:

Insight: [System Requirement|https://documentation.riada.io/insight/latest/system-requirements-29295574.html]


h3. Workaround 

Refer to the vendor documentation for the recommended system requirement.
fields.summary: Update Sizing Guide with message related to plugin

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

* Having just upgraded the license on this Jira server, I get the following error when I try to paste the license:

"The license could not be installed.

This license is not for the selected product. Please make sure that the license is for the selected product and contact Support if the issue continues."

I am trying to enter my new license into JIRA, but there is no mechanism to do so.

The "edit license" button is missing as per the following screenshot with the problem highlighted in red.

How do I add the license I've bought to JIRA?

Originated from: https://getsupport.atlassian.com/projects/CA/queues/custom/424/CA-623849

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: System not providing edit button for the license key to be updated

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
URLs displayed in "Profile">"⚙Tools">"View OAuth Access Tokens" are taken from the description field of {{oauthspconsumer}} where they are not updated after change in configuration of remote instance.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup Jira1 and Jira2, both on localhost
# Link both Jira's
## Make it "OAuth", not "OAuth (impersonation)" both ways
# Link any issue from Jira1 to issue from Jira2 and grant Jira1 access to Jira2.
## Check that "Profile">"⚙Tools">"View OAuth Access Tokens" contains the granted access.
# On Jira2 change hostname to IP address.

h3. Expected Results
"View OAuth Access Tokens" view shows new hostname, that is IP address.

h3. Actual Results
"View OAuth Access Tokens" shows "localhost" and the link leads to this old hostname.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Changing hostname of Jira has no effect on URL displayed in Authorised Applications

fields.description:
Currently, when migrating from Jira Cloud to Jira Server, the Jira Cloud Server ID will overwrite the Jira Server ID (see: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-66787).

This problem often comes to light when an admin then goes to generate a new license from [My Atlassian|https://my.atlassian.com/] using the Server ID. This will fail due to the incorrect format.

We should discuss this in our documentation, either as part of [Migrating from Jira Cloud to Server applications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/migrating-from-jira-cloud-to-server-applications-938846963.html] or a document similar to [Changing Server ID for Test Installations|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/changing-server-id-for-test-installations-285839562.html].
fields.summary: Update Cloud to Server documentation to note Server ID mismatch

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira throws a NPE on shutdown if the full Pico container was not populated

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Start a Jira instance using ./jmake debug --postgres, make sure it starts up properly (e.g. you get to the dashboard).
# Shut down Jira; pressing Ctrl-C is good enough.
# Shut down Postgres.
# Start Jira using ./jmake debug; you should get a Johnson page saying "JIRA failed to establish a connection to your database."
# In a new terminal tab in the same directory, shut down Jira by typing ./jmake debug shutdown.

h3. Expected Results

Jira will shutdown without throwing any errors

h3. Actual Results

The following exception will be thrown:
{code}
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.startup.ClusteringLauncher.stop(ClusteringLauncher.java:46)
	at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher.stop(DefaultJiraLauncher.java:197)
	at com.atlassian.jira.startup.LauncherContextListener.contextDestroyed(LauncherContextListener.java:211)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext.listenerStop(StandardContext.java:4839)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext.stopInternal(StandardContext.java:5478)
{code}

h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: NPE on shutdown in ClusteringLauncher

fields.description:
It would be nice if there was some documentation explaining when JIRA decides whether or not to write to changeitem for Issue history:

* If I set a customfield value through the gui, let's say it's "Story Points" and the value is 5
* THEN I bulk edit those same issues and update "Story Points" to 5
* for the issues that already had "Story Points" = 5 there is no historical data of the change... 


I'm assuming this is expected behavior, but I can't find any thing that says so.
like the mechanism that says OH hey this value hasn't changed no need to update changeitem
This also is the behavior with the REST API, so some sort of clarification would be nice.
fields.summary: Documentation on how changeitem logic works

fields.description:
h3.Summary
There are two CSV import options, One is a limited Bulk Create Option available to all users [(covered in "Creating issues using the CSV importer") | https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/creating-issues-using-the-csv-importer-939938927.html] the other is the external system Import option available to administrators [(covered in "Importing data from CSV") | https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/importing-data-from-csv-938847533.html].  EXE: the estimation fields are only available in the External System Import method

In the Documentation for Creating issues using the CSV importer:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/creating-issues-using-the-csv-importer-939938927.html

Under the section "Tips for importing CSV data into issue fields" it lists Fields that ARE NOT available for this import method, and looks like the table it was copied over from the "Importing data from CSV" documentation where these items do apply, causing confusion between the available options int he Two CSV import options:
* Original Estimate
* Remaining Estimate
* Due Date
* Project
* Comment Body
* Users

h3.Suggested Resolution:
# Please review and verify the available Fields and remove unavailable fields from the list of options on ["Creating issues using the CSV importer" | https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/creating-issues-using-the-csv-importer-939938927.html]
# Add a Note to the page indicating that there are limitations on some fields and refer to ["Importing data from CSV") | https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/importing-data-from-csv-938847533.html] for additional import options on missing fields
# Add A note to the [Commonly asked CSV questions and known issues | https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/commonly-asked-csv-questions-and-known-issues-938847539.html] stressing the differences between the two Import options
# Add Additional links between all three articles with a brief use case description of when to use each of the two CSV import options

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Epics are not created in Jira when data is imported from Pivotal Tracker as documented in [Importing data from Pivotal Tracker|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/importing-data-from-pivotal-tracker-938847553.html]
h3. Environment
 * Jira 7.6
 * Jira Importers Plugin 8.0.15

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a trial account at [http://pivotaltracker.com|http://pivotaltracker.com/]
 # Create a project with epics and stories in those epics
 # Follow steps from [Importing data from Pivotal Tracker|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/importing-data-from-pivotal-tracker-938847553.html] to import data from Pivotal Tracker into Jira

h3. Expected Results

Stories *and* epics should be imported
h3. Actual Results

Epics are not imported to Jira
h3. Notes

* A review of the source code for the Jira Importers Plugin revealed that the *[/epics|https://www.pivotaltracker.com/help/api/rest/v5#Epics]* API endpoint is not called at all. Thus, epics are not retrieved.
* The code of the Jira Importers Plugin needs to use the new v5 API. It is currently using v3
{code:java|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6A8EB3|bgColor=#F8F8F8}
this(uri, UriBuilder.fromUri(uri).path("/services/v3").build(), userNameMapper);
{code}

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira Importer Plugin does not import epics from Pivotal Tracker

fields.summary: Ability to display custom field description in issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When publishing a workflow (System > Workflows > Edit workflow > Publish workflow), the success popup/notification will display question marks in place of non-ASCII characters.

As an example, for the Russian translation, instead of displaying
{code:java}
Черновой процесс был успешно опубликован.
{code}
Jira will display:
{code:java}
???????? ??????? ??? ??????? ???????????.
{code}
h3. Steps to reproduce
 - Change the user language preference to Russian
 - Go to System > Workflows > Edit workflow > Publish workflow without saving a copy
 ** Settings Cog > Система > Задачи > Бизнес-процессы > Редактировать > pubslish workwlow with "Опубликовать" > press "Нет" publish button
 - The message containing question marks appears

h3. Workaround

There is no workaround for this problem available.
h3. Notes

As far as we can tell, only two strings are affected by this. The aforementioned string shown after publishing a workflow, and one error message that's hard to stumple upon in a production environment, looking like the following in the english translation:
{code:java}
admin.warn.user.create.no.group=User "{0}" was created, however there was a problem with setting default groups membership: {1}. Please sync the user directory "{2}" and add the user manually to the groups.{code}
fields.summary: Popup after publishing a workflow displays question marks for non-ASCII characters

*Problem*

The [Jira applications and project types overview|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/jira-applications-and-project-types-overview-938846805.html] lack the information that users from Jira Core and Jira Sofware can't *Edit* and *Schedule Issues* within Jira Service Desk using the default application permissions.

*Suggested Solution*

Improve the [Jira applications and project types overview|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/jira-applications-and-project-types-overview-938846805.html] adding the *Edit* and the *Schedule* cross-project permissions as (x) (not able to) just to be clearer since *Jira Software* and *Jira Core* users can't use those permissions across *Service Desk* projects even if they belong to the groups/role within the Service Desk permission scheme that grants those permissions (They need to be added as Jira Service Desk Agents to be able to perform those operations).

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Username appears multiple times when in JQL filter if user is member of multiple directories

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create the user in Jira Directory,
# Create the same user in another Directory e.g. Active Directory,
# Synchronize this Directory with Jira,
# Now you can see multiple users in JQL,
# Restarting Jira resolves the problem.

h3. Expected Results
Username appears only once

h3. Actual Results
Username appears several times, depending on how many directories is this user member of.

h3. Workaround
# Restart JIRA to clear the user cache.
# Connect Jira to new empty directory, sync it and then remove it:
##  Create new empty (dummy) directory
## Connect new Directory to Jira and synchronize this new Directory (after this step caches will revalidate and duplication should disappear)
## Remove this new empty Directory.
fields.summary: Username appears multiple times when in JQL filter if user is member of multiple directories

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Current Audit logs only record changes in custom field itself and not to custom *field options*. 

Example:
# Create a custom field with checkboxes (yes/no)
# Audit logs will record the creation
# Configure the custom field and change the field options to (approve/reject)
# Audit logs will *not* record this modification
# If we edit the custom field and change the name of add description, audit log will record the change

h3. Suggested Solution
Add *Field options* as a new category to audit changes in the custom field options.


h3. Workaround
none
fields.summary: Add custom field options category in Audit log

fields.description:
It is common to have an LDAP directory that does not support incremental syncs and is moderately sized. These directories don't have the option to lower the sync interval to pick up group membership changes for known users, so admins currently have to trigger syncs from the UI if the sync interval is not an acceptable time to wait for the change to reach Jira. If the REST API had a means of triggering a sync remotely, it would give admins an easy (and scriptable) way to pick up changes to a directory.
h4. Workaround
{panel:borderColor=#FFE7E7|bgColor=#FFE7E7}
(i) The Bash script below runs a directory sync of all enabled directories, be sure to update your credentials. 
(i) The script and its contents are not supported by Atlassian and are only provided on a best-effort basis. Use at your own risk. 
{panel}
{code:bash|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6A8EB3|bgColor=#F8F8F8}
#!/bin/bash

set -x

# we need the base URL of the app (ie: https://jira.domain.com)
BASEURL=$1
[ -z "$BASEURL" ] && echo "usage: $0 BASEURL" && exit 1

# build the URL needed to grab the xtoken
URL="$BASEURL/plugins/servlet/embedded-crowd/directories/list"

# store the cookie as a temp file that is deleted as we finish
COOKIE=/tmp/GetRest.$$
RESP=/tmp/GetToken.$$

# login and save the cookie
curl -k -c $COOKIE -s -X POST \
 --data 'os_username=your_admin_username'  --data 'os_password=your_admin_password' --data "formname=loginform" --data "login='Log In'" \
 "$BASEURL/dologin.action" -o /dev/null

# get the list of sync opertaions by getting the URL with the cookie
curl -k -b $COOKIE -s -X GET "$URL" > $RESP

# here is an example of the sync operation
# href="/plugins/servlet/embedded-crowd/directories/sync?directoryId=10501&atl_token=d5265f974829752eaa45a94011452b1b05f3f730">

# look for all of the available sync operations and call each one-by-one
for i in `grep /sync $RESP | grep atl_token= | grep -v "{id}" | sed 's/^.*href="//; s/".$//'` ; do
        curl -k -b $COOKIE -s -X GET "$BASEURL$i"
done

# delete the temp files
rm -f $COOKIE $TOKEN
{code}
fields.summary: Trigger Directory Syncs using the REST API

fields.description:
h4. Summary

When an issue has enough comments to be collapsed, if there're comments created within the same second, they may be retrieved and displayed incorrectly by Jira.

(i) This bug has a similar concept to JSWSERVER-13996.

h4. Steps to reproduce

So far this is only reproducible by using comment clone functions by 3rd-party add-ons e.g. Clone Plus for Jira or Backbone Issue Sync for Jira:
# Create an issue with 10+ comments
# Use add-on function to clone the comments to another issue
# View the issue where comments are cloned to

(i) Alternatively, manually edit the db to set the comment created values to the same second for all comments.

h4. Expected behavior
Comments are retrieved and displayed correctly as they are in the original issue.

h4. Actual behavior
A random comment may be missing whereas another random comment may be displayed twice.

h4. Cause
This is caused by the way Jira retrieves comments from the database for the Comments tab when there're enough comments to be collapsed. Basically, Jira relies on the *created* column to sort the comments, and it assumes that there's a time gap (1 second+) between any 2 sequential comments. Due to the way comments are cloned using add-on, some comments might be written into the database having exactly the same created values (< 1 second difference), causing the comment sorting mechanism to break.

h4. Notes
# Without collapsing, the problem doesn't appear
#* Collapsing can be disabled by setting _jira.comment.collapsing.minimum.hidden_ to 0 from Advanced Settings
# The problem never appears in All tab (as opposed to Comments tab)

h4. Workarounds
# Vendors to modify add-on code to ensure comments are not created within the same second
# Manually modify the db to set the comment created values to have at least a 1-second gap sequentially
# Disable comment collapsing as per the Notes section
fields.summary: Comments are sorted and displayed incorrectly if they're created within the same second

fields.description:
*Problems:*

Editing the Issue Type and Project context for a custom field is really painful. 

1) When editing the context of a custom field:
 * You cannot easily see which options are already selected
 * It's very easy to accidentally lose previously selected options (no history or rollback once you've selected "modify" - ugh). 

2) When viewing the context of a custom field only the Issue Type icon is displayed - both on the screen showing all Custom Fields and the individual Configure Custom Field screen. If the icon is generic you can only identify the issue type by hovering the mouse over the icon.

*Suggested improvements*

1) Modify the interface so that a different selector is used. eg. see below. This would provide better visibility and make multiple selections easier. 

!image-2019-01-18-10-43-08-692.png|width=547,height=120!

2) Display the Issue Type label as well as the icon on the screen showing all Custom Fields and the screen showing the Custom field config - screenshots below.

!image-2019-01-18-10-43-28-398.png|width=455,height=73!

!image-2019-01-18-10-43-32-837.png|width=441,height=90!

thanks,

Sandra
fields.summary: Custom Field contexts - make it easier to edit them

fields.summary: Kanban Board Name Should Be More Prominent

fields.description:
Currently, all Jira pages lack Open Graph meta tags (cf. http://ogp.me/).
Adding them would enable modern communication systems (such as Mattermost, Rocket.Chat, or even your officially supported Slack) to show an icon, title, and description for every Jira URL that is posted.

GitHub already supports this for all commit, issue, and PR URLs, which highly improves the experience.
Jira shouldn't fall behind here.
fields.summary: Jira pages need Open Graph meta tags to show more information for an URL in modern communication systems

fields.description:
As of Jira 7.13 it is possible for any user with application access to see any other user profile. This can cause security issues when there are external users that need access to a Jira instance, as restricting the project and issues visibility does not restrict their ability to browse all the user's profiles, exposing potentially sensitive information.

The suggestion is to add a function to allow administrators to restrict visibility of user profiles, tentatively with a Global permission.
fields.summary: Allow restricting access to user profiles

fields.description:
Currently if public signup is enabled for a site, users clicking on a link to an issue or page within that site are still asked to request access and the administrators are emailed. If public signup is enabled, prefer not to receive access requests but instead go straight to signup. 

For more, see: https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/With-quot-Anyone-can-join-quot-enabled-in-Site-access-why-are/qaq-p/966281
fields.summary: Do not send access request email when public signup is enabled

 at com.atlassian.jira.util.devspeed.JiraDevSpeedTimer.run(JiraDevSpeedTimer.java:31)
 at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher.start(DefaultJiraLauncher.java:103)
 at com.atlassian.jira.startup.LauncherContextListener.initSlowStuff(LauncherContextListener.java:157)
 at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
 2019-01-11 11:34:38,342 JIRA-Bootstrap INFO [c.a.jira.index.LuceneCorruptionChecker] Performing detailed check if index '/var/jira/caches/indexes/changes'. It may take some time.
 2019-01-11 11:34:40,370 JIRA-Bootstrap INFO [c.a.jira.index.LuceneCorruptionChecker] Index '/var/jira/caches/indexes/changes' is healthy. Proceeding...{noformat}

h3. Expected Results

Since LuceneCorruptionChecker is able to correctly detect the corruption, we would expect it to fix the corruption as well, or report something else but "index is healthy" in case it cannot fix the corruption.

h3. Actual Results

LuceneCorruptionChecker is reporting the index as healthy when it is clearly not.

h3. Workaround

Try to re-index manually, if this also does not work, delete the index files manually, those will be repopulated after that due to full reindexing.
fields.summary: LuceneCorruptionChecker is not processing corrupted indexes

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The Jira Data Center CloudFormation templates don't contain the options for the newest AWS EC2 instance types.

For example {{c5.\*}} instance types are not included, while {{c3.\*}} are provided. {{r5.\*}} instance types are not included either. Please update the CloudFormation template to allow picking of these instance types too given the eventual deprecation of  {{c3.\*}}

h3. Suggested Solution
Update the CloudFormation templates to provide the option to use the newest generation.
fields.summary: As an admin running Jira Server on AWS, I would like the CloudFormation templates to be updated to add the newest Instance type generations

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Duplicate JIRA license of the same type (Core, Software, or Service Desk ) will cause JIRA instance to go down. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Input any of the JIRA license type, let's say Software license in this case into a JIRA instance. 
 # Access the database directly and update another Software license into the database table *_productlicense_*. 

h3. Expected Results

Jira will able to still start up or work properly but warn the administrators about the duplicate license. 

h3. Actual Results

The JIRA unable to start up / not working. 

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
2019-01-14 13:32:40,653 ThreadPoolAsyncTaskExecutor::Thread 7 ERROR      [c.a.p.osgi.factory.OsgiPlugin] Unable to start the plugin container for plugin 'com.atlassian.analytics.analytics-client'
org.springframework.beans.factory.UnsatisfiedDependencyException: Error creating bean with name 'productEventListener' defined in URL [bundle://19.0:0/META-INF/spring/atlassian-plugins-components.xml]: Unsatisfied dependency expressed through constructor argument with index 4 of type [com.atlassian.analytics.client.logger.AnalyticsLogger]: Error creating bean with name 'analyticsLogger' defined in URL [bundle://19.0:0/META-INF/spring/atlassian-plugins-components.xml]: Bean instantiation via constructor failed; nested exception is org.springframework.beans.BeanInstantiationException: Failed to instantiate [com.atlassian.analytics.client.logger.Log4jAnalyticsLogger]: Constructor threw exception; nested exception is com.atlassian.cache.CacheException: java.lang.IllegalStateException: More than once license contains access to 'jira-software'. The licenses are: License for [jira-software]: AAAB2w0ODAoPeNp9kkFvozAQhe/+FZb2FskE2.... and License for [jira-software]: AAAB2g0ODAoPeNp9kk9vozAQxe/+FJb2Fskkk.....; nested exception is org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanCreationException: Error creating bean with name 'analyticsLogger' defined in URL [bundle://19.0:0/META-INF/spring/atlassian-plugins-components.xml]: Bean instantiation via constructor failed; nested exception is org.springframework.beans.BeanInstantiationException: Failed to instantiate [com.atlassian.analytics.client.logger.Log4jAnalyticsLogger]: Constructor threw exception; nested exception is com.atlassian.cache.CacheException: java.lang.IllegalStateException: More than once license contains access to 'jira-software'. The licenses are: License for [jira-software]: AAAB2w0ODAoPeNp9kkFvozAQhe/+FZb2FskE2.... and License for [jira-software]: AAAB2g0ODAoPeNp9kk9vozAQxe/+FJb2Fskkk.....
	at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.ConstructorResolver.createArgumentArray(ConstructorResolver.java:749)
	at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.ConstructorResolver.autowireConstructor(ConstructorResolver.java:185)
	at 
...
...
Caused by: org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanCreationException: Error creating bean with name 'analyticsLogger' defined in URL [bundle://19.0:0/META-INF/spring/atlassian-plugins-components.xml]: Bean instantiation via constructor failed; nested exception is org.springframework.beans.BeanInstantiationException: Failed to instantiate [com.atlassian.analytics.client.logger.Log4jAnalyticsLogger]: Constructor threw exception; nested exception is com.atlassian.cache.CacheException: java.lang.IllegalStateException: More than once license contains access to 'jira-software'. The licenses are: License for [jira-software]: AAAB2w0ODAoPeNp9kkFvozAQhe/+FZb2FskE2.... and License for [jira-software]: AAAB2g0ODAoPeNp9kk9vozAQxe/+FJb2Fskkk.....
	at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.ConstructorResolver.autowireConstructor(ConstructorResolver.java:275)
{noformat}

h3. Notes

- This issue was encountered in one of the Atlassian Support tickets and it was not reproducible without having to modify it through the database. So the actual cause of the issue is not known yet other than being able to reproduce the error. 
- This issue is major as it will block the instance from starting up, so a mechanism for this to fail-safe or catch the exception is required. 

h3. Workaround

Simply compare the license key in the *_productlicense_* database table with the license key from My Atlassian ([https://my.atlassian.com/]) and remove the non-valid/old license key by the following SQL query by replacing the *12345*, *54321* with the duplicate IDs: 
{code:sql} 
DELETE FROM productlicense WHERE id = (12345,54321); 
{code}
fields.summary: Duplicate JIRA license of the same type ( Core , Software , or Service Desk ) will cause JIRA instance to go down

fields.description:
When viewing an issue, whether in Jira or in the Customer Portal there is the possibility that more than one user will be accessing it, and while the issue is already loaded in the web browser of one user, another user can add a comment or even change the status, and the other users that already have the issue open won't notice this, until they try to perform an action like moving the issue to a different status or refreshing. 

Another scenario that may happen is when using automation: if there is an automation to change the status after a comment is made, the user triggering the automation to change the status will not see the change until they refresh, and if they try to transition the issue after making a comment, it will indicate "You can not make this transition" which can be confusing.

The suggested solution is to have issues being updated asynchronously (at least the status) so it would reflect the change immediately.
fields.summary: Update issues asynchronously in the client when they change on the server side
When Jira connects to itself using "localhost" as rendering gadgets, error message being logged: Certificate for <localhost> doesn't match any of the subject alternative names .

fields.description:
Issue is only reproducible on Windows. Unable to reproduce on Chrome on MacOS.

*Environment*
 Jira 7.12.3
 Chrome on Windows

*Steps to reproduce*
 Create custom field of type "Select List (Single choice)" and add it to screens
 Create new issues and click in the custom field drop down

*Observed behaviour*
 The bottom is cut off and letters like "g","p","q","y" won't display correctly
!Custom_field_1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Values in custom Jira fields are not displaying correctly, bottom of some letters are cut off

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Clicking on the result row menu at the most right when there are many columns that involved horizontal scrolling will scroll the user back to the most left. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Issue Navigator and change to list view. 
# Add more columns until it exceeds the screen width which will need horizontal scrolling. 
# Click on the result row menu (three dots). 

h3. Expected Results

The menu just opens at the current view. 

h3. Actual Results

The menu did opens but it scrolls the view all the way back to the most left. 

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Clicking on the result row menu at the most right when there are many columns that involved horizontal scrolling will scroll the user back to the most left

fields.description:
Jira is integrated with Crowd SSO, and setting password expiration date for directory in Crowd.

When the password is expired, user cannot login Jira and did not know the reason for the failure.

It would be nice to notify user the password has expired in Jira and direct to Crowd update password page.

fields.description:
It would be useful if we could create charts that would enable us to add visualization of various fields' values on the vertical axis and which we could then group by tickets.

Let's say we have fields "Time to resolution" and "Costs", so we could then include those two fields to be visible on the chart (bar chart type) for each ticket included in the chart.
fields.summary: Add functionality to create charts that include several fields on vertical axis

fields.description: As the Danish government IT-Agency, banned the use of POP and IMAP on the government network, I suggest that Atlassian starts supporting integration with Exchange server using EWS, since all the public agencies in Denmark will not be able to use e-mail integration with Jira Service Desk and Jira Software.
fields.summary: Support of Exchange WEB Service integration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Creating a  "Process Management" project type, will create a Project Management Resolve Issue Screen

h3. Environment
JIRA 7.10.2, 7.13

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project called "JIRA" in your JIRA instance
# Create a new filter as below, save it and share it with everyone.
{code}
project = JIRA AND assignee = currentUser()
{code}
(i) You can choose to use your existing JIRA project if you want, do ensure you update the filter accordingly if you do so.
# Create 10 users and assign with *JIRA Software User* group
# Create 2 issues and assign to user 1
# Create another few issue assign to the user 2
# Subscribe *JIRA Software User* group to the filter we created earlier
# Do ensure you do not tick *"email this filter, even if there are no issues found"*
# Trigger the subscription 1-2 times or more
# Access to [*Mail Queue*|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/the-mail-queue-151387.html] and you will see JIRA generate subscription mail for all 10 users in *JIRA Software User* group even though 8 of them shouldn't return any results in the filter
(i) These emails were generated in [*Mail Queue*|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/the-mail-queue-151387.html], however only those with results sends out to correct recipient (user 1 and user 2)

h3. Expected Results
JIRA should only trigger subscription email to 2 of the recipient in [*Mail Queue*|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/the-mail-queue-151387.html]. 

h3. Actual Results
JIRA trigger subscription email to all recipient in JIRA Software User group. It triggered for all users, but this doesn't send out to the 8 users which listed in the [*Mail Queue*|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/the-mail-queue-151387.html]. It seems *"email this filter, even if there are no issues found"* had filtered out those email to send out. 

h3. Workaround
-
fields.summary: Subscribe Filter To A Large Group Of User Causing JIRA Trigger Subscription Mail To All User In The Group Even If "email this filter, even if there are no issues found" Was Unchecked.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create JQL with {{project IN (...)}} clause, which contains long list of projects(id, key or name)
 # Execute sequence of searches, increase number of projects in clause

h3. Expected Results

Performance of search doesn't degrade
h3. Actual Results

Search performance is degrading proportionally to number of projects.

Getting list of projects involved in JQL query is expensive:
{code:java}
2019-01-04 21:33:40,808 http-nio-8080-exec-18 DEBUG admin 1293x406x1 7uj3d3 89.64.38.139 /rest/issueNav/1/issueTable [c.a.util.profiling.UtilTimerStack] [113ms] - Searching and sorting with Collector
      [113ms] - Lucene Search
        [38ms] - Get Query Projects
        [11ms] - Permission Query
        [0ms] - DefaultJqlOperandResolver.getValues() - multivalue
          [0ms] - MultiValueOperandHandler.getValues()
{code}
Note 38ms spent on getting projects from query, which is much more than 11ms spend on generating permission query based on that list.

 
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround for this behaviour.
fields.summary: JQL with long list of projects is slower in 7.10

fields.description: Greetings.  It would be a nice feature for project administrators to be able to have more control over their screen scheme.  We have hundreds of projects for a large installation with several project managers and business units.  Being able to make fields required would be a great feature to have.
fields.summary: Extended Project Administrators permissions to make fields required

fields.description: Greetings.  It would be a nice feature for project administrators to be able to edit their issue type scheme.  We have hundreds of projects for a large installation with several project managers and business units.  Being able to add and remove issue types from their project and associate them with pre-existing workflows would be a welcome addition.
fields.summary: Extended Project Administrators permissions to edit issue type scheme

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Whenever canceling the {{Create Branch}} pop up while there's a comment written on the Comment box, the browser tab will freeze until it is closed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Connect Jira and BitBucket
# Access a Jira issue 
# Start writing a comment on the comment box but don't press {{Add}}
# Click on {{Create Branch}}
# A pop up will appear asking if you'd like to leave the page. Click {{Cancel}}


h3. Expected Results

The pop up will close and Jira will resume accordingly.

h3. Actual Results

At this point, the tab will freeze and require a new tab to be opened. 

h3. Workaround

Close and open another tab.

fields.description: Greetings.  I think it would be a great addition to the product if project administrators were allowed to add and remove fields to and from their project screens.  Is this something Atlassian is considering? Apologies if this is a duplicate, but I couldn't find an existing issue for this specific suggestion.

fields.description: Greetings.  We all appreciate the new abilities Atlassian developers have given our project administrators over the past couple of years, but a lot of our (full admins) time is spent in the areas of advanced workflow customization.  It would save us a lot of time if project administrators could associate and change transition screens as well as make changes to transition options, including Properties, Triggers, Conditions, Validators, and Post Functions.
fields.summary: Extended Project Administrator permissions for advanced workflow options

Each issue should correspond to 1 bar.

fields.description:
When Jira fails to process an attachment for a message, it adds a message to the ticket. When it does so, it does so anonymously - and the {{author}} column in the {{jiraaction}} table is blank. 

This can have repercussions in other places, where a null value isn't expected - for example [JRASERVER-68560|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-68560].
fields.summary: When an attachment can't be added, use a value other than null for the author

fields.description:
h4. Problem Definition
When deleting an Issue linking, there is no way to track the progress via the user interface. Depending on the number of issues with links, this task may take a while to complete, and there is not a way to know how long it's going to take.

h4. Suggested solution
It would be useful to have a progress bar indicating how much time is left when deleting a Link type.
fields.summary: Include Progress Bar In Delete Link Type
Delete Issue Link causes Error rendering 'com.atlassian.jira.jira-view-issue-plugin:linkingmodule' and some Dashboard gadgets
Ability to bulk clone without a plugin
Ability to add watchers to a scheduled task before it is launched.

fields.description:
Using the Service Desk Portal, the search on a partial word (substring) works on all fields. The user can select a field and start typing partial words of the preferred value. Jira will displays all the field values which contains the typed characters, independently of the position.

However, when a user is creating or modifying an issue within a Project (Create & Edit Issue Screen), then the search on partial word does NOT work properly. Jira displays only those field values which +begins+ with the partial word that the user has just typed in. This is very inconvinient and generates huge effort to users to find the desired value in a very long list, especially if the user does not know how the value starts but he/she knows partial words.

Jira partial word search needs to be fixed on the Create & Edit Issue Screen.
fields.summary: Search on partial word (substring) does not work on Create & Edit Issue Screen

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using the WYSIWYG editor on Jira to change font color, if a different color was already selected for that text, Jira will keep the color that was selected first.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start in 'Text' view mode in the description box.
# Type some text in the description box for any type of ticket.
# While in the editor, highlight any portion of the text then select a font color in the toolbar above.
# Save and view the changes to see the new font color.
# Select the same text in 'Visual' view mode and change the font color to a different color.

h3. Expected Results

Jira will change the font color accordingly.

h3. Actual Results

Jira will keep displaying the old color.
 
h3. Notes

When reproducing this issue, after changing back from *Visual* to *Text*, it will display two color definitions (old and new). Example: {color:#0747a6}{color:#de350b}Example{color}

h3. Workaround

Remove the previous color definition while on text mode.
fields.summary: WYSIWYG editor on Jira does not work properly when changing font color

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the Free space health check has failed to run it produces the message.
{quote}
 The Free Space health check has failed in your system. 
{quote}
This message is misleading and causes the user to think that there is no free space rather than the health check itself has failed to run.

 
h3. Expected Results

Either
 * Do not produce a warning when the Free Space health check has failed to run.
 * Reword the warning to be explicitly clear that it is the Free Space health check that has failed to run and is not a lack of free space.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The Free space health check has failed in your system error message is misleading.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Due to the bug reported in [*JRASERVER-59812*|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59812], when we upgrade from JIRA 6.4 to latest JIRA Version with JIRA 7.0 as the intermediate version. We will hit into JRASERVER-59812 bug which causing gadget preference goes wrong. Although it was being fixed in JIRA 7.6.6, 7.7.4, 7.8.2, 7.9.0 onwards, upgrading from JIRA 7.0 XML backup to a fixed version user will still encountering the same issue as JIRA 7.0 XML containing wrong gadget preference details.

h3. Environment
JIRA 7.0.x, JIRA 7.8.2, JIRA 7.13

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Reproduce the behavior in [*JRASERVER-59812*|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59812] ticket in JIRA 7.0
 # Upgrade to JIRA 7.8.2 or JIRA 7.13
 # Access to the gadget and you shall see the issue persist

h3. Expected Results
Upgrade to a fixed version, wrong configurations gadget details shall be fixed accordingly.

h3. Actual Results
Once we upgrade from an impacted JIRA version to a fixed JIRA version, the issue remains as XML backup/database generated from older JIRA Version was having wrong configurations such as preference.

{code}
2018-12-21 23:53:00,085 http-nio-8080-exec-3 WARN rhaverin 1432x406x1 1hrivnx 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/dashboards/1.0/13152/gadget/17625/prefs [c.a.jira.dashboard.JiraDashboardStateStoreManager] Stored state for dashboard with id '13152' is not the same as in-memory state. Trying to rewrite the entire state...
2018-12-21 23:53:00,477 pool-14-thread-1 INFO jiraadmin 1429x132x1 1l1ep0s 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /plugins/servlet/embedded-crowd/directories/disable [auditorlog] Event{author=rhaverin, ipAddress=0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1, category=Dashboards, summary=Gadget configuration edited, object=MS6 Guarantee Basic, details=[EventDetail{name=Dashboard name, value=MS6 Guarantee Basic}, EventDetail{name=Gadget name, value=Pie Chart}, EventDetail{name=Gadget url, value=rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.jira.gadgets:pie-chart-gadget/gadgets/piechart-gadget.xml}, EventDetail{name=projectOrFilterId, oldValue=filter-11441, newValue=null}]}
{code}

h3. Notes
Upgrade from JIRA 6.4 to any latest JIRA Version will require to go through JIRA 7.0.x due to JIRA Agile and JIRA Service Desk minimum requirement.

h3. Workaround
Reconfigure the dashboards
fields.summary: Upgrade from JIRA 7.0 to latest JIRA version with JRASERVER-59812 Bug Fix Did Not Fix Those Lost Dashboard Gadget configuration

fields.description:
*Problem.* 

While foreground reindexing, disk space usage could surge to double the current size of the index directory. This could lead to indexing process to fail midway when there is insufficient disk space availability leaving the instance with broken index. 

From Lucene document
[https://lucene.apache.org/core/5_0_0/core/org/apache/lucene/index/IndexWriter.html#addDocument(java.lang.Iterable])
{quote}Merges temporarily consume space in the directory. The amount of space required is up to 1X the size of all segments being merged, when no readers/searchers are open against the index, *and up to 2X the size of all segments being merged when readers/searchers are open against the index (see forceMerge(int) for details).* The sequence of primitive merge operations performed is governed by the merge policy.{quote}
*Suggestion.* 

Jira should check for disk space availability (at least double the current index size) or display warning to user.
fields.summary: Jira should check disk space availability prior re-indexing

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At this moment, we don't have a REST API endpoint to edit Issue Security Levels. We can only GET the Issue Security Level in a given ID.

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement an endpoint that would allow editing the Issue Security Level so that we can automate the management of the Issue Security Levels, especially when there are a lot of them.

h3. Why this is important
This would make easier the management of the Security Level and we can also automate this management process.
 
h3. Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: Create an endpoint to edit Issue Security Level via REST API

fields.description:
Creating an issue through the QuickIssueCreate lightbox causes a pop-up to appear with a link to the newly created ticket. Several of my users have said that this does not make sense for their workflow. They suggest that it would be more natural if they were immediately taken to the issue they just created.

Further, there have been a few cases where issues have had incorrect information entered into them, when the user hasn't realized that they aren't looking at the new issue. Sometimes the user realizes and cancels the edit, but if the current issue and the new issue look similar enough, they may not notice and then you have a lying ticket.

Some other users appreciate the current behaviour, so I suggest a configuration option in the Preferences section of a user's profile. Something like a checkbox that says "automatically open newly created tickets." Or, in keeping with the current screen for user preferences, a drop-down menu that would enable this feature.

I've made my users aware of various workarounds, including right-clicking the 'Create' button to open the link in a new tab, thus avoiding the lightbox. However we all feel that the point of software like Jira is to minimize the potential for human error that impacts the integrity of the information in issues.

Thanks for your consideration,
fields.summary: Per-user option to automatically go to tickets created via lightbox

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Clicking "Cancel" on Screen Scheme Association page leads to error: "No project could be found with key 'screens'".

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a project
# Click on Project settings;
# Click on Screens page
# Click on Actions > Use a different scheme
# Now click on Cancel button

h3. Expected Results
Jira should return to the previous page (project settings > Screens)>

h3. Actual Results
Jira returns the following error:
{{No project could be found with key 'screens'.}}
 !screenshot.jpeg|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
The 'Cancel' URL link leads to wrong link: 
{{<baseURL>/plugins/servlet/project-config//screens}}
but the original link should be:
{{<baseURL>/plugins/servlet/project-config/<project_key>/screens}}

It is visible that the project key is missing between two slash characters ( // )

h3. Workaround
To get back to the "Screens" page, insert project key between slashes in the {{<baseURL>/plugins/servlet/project-config//screens}} link and resend the request.
fields.summary: Clicking "Cancel" on Screen Scheme Association page leads to error: "No project could be found with key 'screens'"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Previewing a PDF in the Issue View gives inconsistent behavior in text notes (transparency)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create/open a PDF and add a text note with solid background color, using any tool, like Adobe Acrobat or PDF Exchange Reader.
# Open the issue in IE 11 or Edge
# Attach the file to an issue in Jira
# From the attachment list, click in the PDF file to preview it

h3. Expected Results
The text box background color is shown as a solid color.

h3. Actual Results
The text note background color appears transparent.  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
* This does not happen in Google Chrome or Mozilla Firefox.

h3. Workaround
Using Chrome or Firefox browsers.
fields.summary: Previewing a PDF in the Issue View gives inconsistent behavior in text notes (transparency)
As an administrator, I want the /auditing/record/ REST endpoint to reflect the current record total when applying a filter

fields.description:
Public facing bug for: JRASERVER-61351

h3. Issue Summary
Clicking on thumbnails of images brings up images from an unrelated ticket, which does not match the thumbnails.


h3. Steps to Reproduce (Example)
*Wrong URLs:*
https://HOST/secure/attachment/2131980/2131980_example1.PNG

Correct URLs:
https://HOST/secure/attachment/2141711/example2.png

The attachment links in the attachment section at the top of the ticket go to the right place, but the thumbnails do not.

h3. Expected Results
The correct image is opened corresponding to the correct thumbnail.

h3. Notes
We confirmed that affected users can't view attachments for issues they do not have access to. 

h3. Workaround
The behavior will work as expected after a set amount of time, usually less than an hour. The issue can usually not be consistently replicated, so it may be caused by a race condition.
fields.summary: Intermittently, an attachment from a different issue opens from the thumbnail of an unrelated issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Exporting issues to HTML including the Team portfolio field makes resulting file unopenable

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # From the Issue navigator, make a search with a large number of results, including the field 'Team' provided by Jira Portfolio (10k+ issues, preferably).
 # Export the file to HTML.
 # Open the file with your preferred spreadsheet program.

h3. Expected Results
The file is opened

h3. Actual Results
The program starts loading the file and after a while stops responding, staying stuck until forcefully closed.

h3. Notes
* Tested in MS Excel and LibreOffice Calc with the same results.
* The problem seems come from the field 'Team' including an image on each row, which causes a much greater load for the program opening it, even when the file size between the one that includes the Team field is similar to the one that doesn't.

h3. Workarounds
* Avoid including the field 'Team' from Portfolio for exports.
* Export to CSV
** This could be usable only in certain scenarios as there are fields that are not exported to CSV in the same way they are in HTML.
fields.summary: Exporting issues to HTML including the Team portfolio field makes resulting file unopenable

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, when a worklog is updated, there is no option to notify only the worklog author about the changes made to a worklog. This feature is important for the worklog author to be notified if the team lead made some changes in their worklog, for example, due to an error in the worklog which helps in avoiding the said error in the future.
fields.summary: Add an option to notify worklog creator when changes are made to their worklog in Notification Scheme

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After changing the name of Security Level, JQL will still be using the old Security Level name.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a Security Level and assign an issue the Security Level
2. Search for the Security Level via JQL
3. Rename the Security Level
4. Searching the new Security Level name via JQL will result in an error

h3. Expected Results
The new name is reflected and be used by JQL instantly after the name has been changed

h3. Actual Results
The new name will not be reflected in JQL after the change and still uses the old name

h3.Workaround
Restarting the JIRA instance or waiting for a period of time : 30 minutes or 1 hour (it seems to depend on the instance size)
fields.summary: Renaming Security Level will not reflect in the JQL

fields.description:

Thanks
